text: On tap at moeder lambic. Clear ywllow colour small white head. Nose is light crisp sourness. Horseblanket. Taste is light sourness, strong lactic acids. Strong green apple. Light acetic acid. Crisp and refreshig.
Vom Fass im Muted Horn Berlin 2017-04 getrunken. Ein Klassiker diese typische Gueuze. Verdammt lecker.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Slightly hazy orange with white head. Sweetish aroma with notes of brett, hay, apricot, wild yeasts. Sourish and bitterish flavor with notes of yeasts, yogurt, apricot, a bit "green", acidic, dry. Medium-bodied. Very good.
W końcu :) Intensywny aromat Brettów w stronę siana i owoców, bardzo świeże. Wysoko wysycone, owocowe, lekkie taniny, wyraźnie kwaśne. Bdb.
At Mikkeller and Friends, Pours golden with a decent head, aroma of fruits, brett, tea, fresh, flavor is sour and acidic with lemon, tea, medium to full bodied, great
Tap Clear orange colour with no head.Aroma of funk and oranges with nice fruity flavor aswell,medium body with hint of oak and fruits,nice and mild tart finish and really easy to drink beer.
Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy orange. Aroma is funky, citrus, oak. Sour lemon, wood, apples, citrus, herbs. Light-medium bodied, dry and smooth. Tasty.
On tap at the Beer Trappe. Aroma is funky and complex. Taste is sour with salt and some bitterness.

Ca;a en el lúpulo 23..04..2017 color amarillento anaranjado sabores frescos malteses con frescos ácidos herbáceos algo cítricos que dejan suave amargo final. Cuerpo ligero a medio algo espumoso. Bastante buena

At Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours clear amber. Aroma of an old damp cellar which hasnt seen fresh air in 50 years. But good in a way. Body is medium, sour and tart, lively to fizzy carbonation, good funk, quite intense and complex. Palate lingers on funk and sour bitterness. Very, very good.

On tap at Muted Horn Berlin. Comes with a clear orange color and a small white head, which disappears very quick. Fine nose of vinegar, sour grapes and apples, sloightly salty. Taste follows the nose. Nice sour finish. Medium carbonation. Good one!

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Draft at moeder lambic fontainas. Pours clear orange, shortlived head. Nose is white wine vinegar, white grapes, sour apple, lemon. Palate is zesty lemon, white grapes, sour apples, sour finish that leaves a sour taste in you mouth. This gets more Drinkable over the course of the glass. Very good, could be just a touch less sour in the finish, or it could be compensated by some sweetnees.

F: medium size, white, quick gone.
C: deep gold, light hazy.
A: woody, citric, orange peels, apple, horse-blanket, barnyard, Brett, basement. 
T: sampled from tap at ACBF 2017, Brett, woody, strong funky, apples, cheese, barnyard, fruity, very good balanced, complex, enjoyed.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 On tap at In De Wildeman. Hazy orange with a white head. Notes of macerated apples, salt, minerals, quite a bit of lambic funk, damp cellar, mould. Medium body and carbonation. Delicious.

On draught. Pours a clear orange amber, with a moderate white head which persists. Nose is a slight aroma of funk and orange. Taste follows, with a moderate tartness and a short clean finish. Very nice.
Keg at Beer Gonzo; slightly hazed light copper pour with a tiny white head, aroma has funky straw action, taste has lip puckering sourness, fresh lemon, great stuff.

Tried at the Beer Gonzo Tap Room, Coventry. Colour was crystal orange golden with a thin white head. Aroma is mainly fruity with a some citrus acidity. Taste citrus sour and light orange sweet. Full body.

Draft at Beer Gonzo Taproom opening 27/01/17

Cloudy amber white head. Classic Gueuze. Sour, spritely, Tangy, Zesty, fresh. Lovely.
On tap. Hazy golden with a thin white head. Funky, barnyard, citrus and grassy. Very good.
@beergonzo Tap room. Golden orange with small head. Farmyard funky and dusty carpet aroma. Taste is tart sour and citrusy with oranges, elderflower, apricot & band aid. Very tasty and moorish.

Keg at Akkurat. Pours slightly turbid orange with a medium white head which recedes to a foamy layer. Aroma is fruity and slightly citric. Taste is citric sour, slight orange sweet, slightly peppery, orange zest.

Pours gold, small head.
Nose shows funk, lemon rind, elderflower, leather, horseblanket, hay, unripe plum.
Flavours include lemon, peach, musty funk, a solid whack of acidity, lemon pith.

Cask. Pours a lightly hazy orange with a fading fluffy white head. Aroma is of citrus, funky, grassy, caramel, natural yoghurt, funky, tart. Taste is of citrus, funky, lightly acidic, tart, white grapes, hint of dried fruits. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2017 Aroma: appelcider en goudbloem. In de smaak is het zuur mooi uitgebalanceerd, geen wrange nasmaak, redelijk smoothe afdronk.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2015, Olympia, London Aug 2015 - Hazy Yellow in colour. Average foamy off-white head. Excellent lacing. Yeasty and Spicy; funk, barnyard, earth. Malty; hay, straw. Fruity; sour citrus fruits, lemon. Hoppy; grassy hops. Tart and very dry. Very drinkable. Tart bitterness, yeasty, citrus fruity and dry throughout. Lovely. Wow! Easily the best beer I had at GBBF 2015. Fantastic Gueuze! (2015-08-15)

Chucks CD, 3rd Anniversary Party. Real deal gueze, obv, and its a treat. A touch mellower and body rich than the bottles. But flavors are right there, only turned down a notch. Dry yeasty funk on nose. Touch sweet and white grape and champagne. Malt roundness before overtaken by snappy, fantastic sour and tartness. Dries out well. The nice kind of tannic astringency. Smooth, fairly light and delightful. Love this.

From notes. Enjoyed on draft at Moeder Lambic  Fontainas on November 10 with Kathleen. Not sure what the special difference here is, but this is the correct rating. The pour is a pale golden yellow with a thinner white head that fades quickly, leaving a thin ring and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is incredibly acidic. The fruits and citrus in this are pretty large, as well as the mineral tendency of a good gueuze. There is a light vinegar on a deep inhale. The flavor is also good. There is a complex mineral component to go with a nice citric acid, a funkiness, a lovely tart fruit skin, and a dustiness on the finish. Its really complex, and I like it. The mouth feel is a little heavier than I was looking for, but the carbonation is great and the aftertaste is a little more mineral dominated than I would like. Its a good beer.

On Tap @Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Bruselas 06/12/16 
Color amarillo dorado, rica, final acido.
On tap at Bevog Who Cares Festival, 2016. Pours hazy deep yellow with white head. Citrus, grapefruit, horse blanket, funky, some yeast, quite sour, dry. Light to medium bodied. Refreshing.

Pours foggy light amber with low white head 
Aromas tart of cracked garden branch, garden leaves, over ripe red apples 
Taste has tart notes of earth, garden leaves, over ripe apples, sour grapes , cracked garden branch

Draught. Pours quite clear, yellow in colour with small white head. Aroma of barnyard, citrus, tart fruits, leather and wood. In taste lightly sweet at start, fruity and tart with moderate sour, dry and tart finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Golden color with medium white head. Sour aroma with vinous notes, wood, bayrnard. Taste, nice sourness, wood, marzipan, vinous. Very good.
Tap. Golden tan beer with minimal white tan. Aroma of zest and lemon. Taste is sour and light bitter with dry aftertaste. Medium body and high carbonation. Nice beer.
Keg. Pours amber with no head and no carbonation. Scent is fairly light lambic. Taste is medium dry and medium sour with a fairly sessionable finish. Great.
Keg at the brauhaus. Pours deep golden orange, nose is funk, lemon, horseblanket, taste is juicy fruit, funky, tart, wood.
thanks for the correcting, This is the version what i drank at #1 barboteur beer days @Brussels.

Draft sample during Zwanze 2016. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. The aroma has grass notes, funky, fruity cheese notes. Strong acidity. A bit earthy. Medium body and high carbonation. Great stuff.

On draft at Avenue Pub. Pours a hazy dark gold color. Stale sweat, horse blanket, strawberry. Medium sourness. Acetone light body strong carbonation. Light sweetness upfront that is pulled away by a very dry finish.

Alles gut. Ist halt sehr leicht und viele der Aromen kommen dadurch nur schwach zur Geltung. Fruchtig, würzig und mit den typischen Funk ausgestattet, ist diese Gueuze durch und durch solide. 0,1/1 Jetson, von Fass beim ZYTHOS BEER FESTIVAL 2016 in Leuven.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Gueuze Tilquin (Draft Version) by Gueuzerie Tilquin at BierCabTilquin - bardzo wytrawne, lekko owocowe (niedojrzale jablka? ale nie aldehyd), cierpkie. Funky w aromacie mocne. Naaajs.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Small sample during Carnivale Brettanomyces 16. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Arome is very nice and tart with some yoghurt and citrus. Taste is medium sour with citrus, some barn, yoghurt, quite a dry finish. Medium body and carbo. Nice stuff.
Draught at the Beer Trappe. Not sure what the overall difference is between this and bottled, but funky yeasty lemon goodness.

Unclear, golden-yellow colored, small white head, only a ring. Aroma is of light malt, medium tartness, some lemon, bit funky. Taste is medium to light sweet malt, lemon, some fruit, medium tart sourness, barnyard, dry finish, light+ bitterness. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
(on tap, Bevog Who Cares Festival)

On tap at Who Cares for Beer 2016 Beer Festival, Bevog Brewery, Bad Radkersburg, Austria. Shared with His Highness Kaiser und König Igor and Rasta Teacher Mark. Murky brownish golden, off-white head. Dusty, yeasty, spicy, pastry. Moderately sour. Soft carbonation, medium body, moderate finish. Very interesting spicy aroma.

Tap at Bevog Festival. Pours a cloudy yellow to orange body with a small white rim around the edge of the glas. Aroma of ripe squashed lemons, dough, earthy notes, sour green apples, fresh rhubarb. Taste is salty, with funky sour notes. Intense, but not overwhelming. Body feels light, slightly creamy like cloudy apple juice, with almost fizzy carbonation and a slightly astringent, sour and fruity finish.
My first venture into the land of Gueuze/Gose. Very refreshing, definitely bending what we Austrians learned to perceive as beer. Great balance between earthy notes, fruit and sour funkiness with a dash of salt.
This requires a personal Thanks You to Bevogs Vasja Golar, who introduced his audience to it.

0,2l from tap at Bevog Festival shared with iznogud. orange rather hazy color, small white head. smells sour, funky, rather barnyardy, green apples, light wood, nice smell. light body, medium carbonation, light bit astringent mouthfeel. tastes citric, rather sour, some funk, nice barnyard notes, some wood, green apples, very lightly nutty. finishes rather sour with nice citric, funky and green apple notes. very nice and refreshing, quite sour but overall great balance. love it.

Slightly hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma has really nice farmhouse funk and fermented fruits. Taste is quite sour but not puckering. It has nice fruity flavors like lemon, lime, unripe plums and apricots and also lambic funk flavors like hay and barnyard. Body is dry and well carbonated. Overall its a really nice, easy drinking gueuze.

Rating #1881 - 2015.09.11 - Draught @revolutionyeg - Pours hazy golden with a bubbly white head. Aroma of apricot jelly, lemon juice, and Brett. Quite tart and juicy with a pronounced sourness - lingering acidity into the finish. Gorgeous stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Fat på Bishop Gustav, Malmö (var annars ;-). Mycket funk/stallkaraktär, ganska mjuk med tydlig men snäll syra, fat, krusbär, rabarber, syrliga äpplen, citrus och vete. Massor av karaktär, jämna fina rena smaker i fantastisk balans. Inget som stör. Aningen sötma och fin torrhet.Mycket, mycket gott!

Fat (obviously) på Bishop Gustav, Malmö. Mycket funk/stallkaraktär, ganska mjuk men tydlig syra, fat, syrliga äpplen, citrus och vete. Massor av karaktär och ändå så drickbar inte en tillstymmelse till oxiderade toner eller vinäger, aningen sötma och inte inte supertorr. Fantastiskt gott.

Draft (surprise, huh?). Semi-clear golden with one finger white head. Aroma is tart and acidic with funk, zesty citrus, wood and some hay. Taste is rather acidic with a nice tartness to it and citrus zest, funk, hay, light wood and light barnyard. Tart medium mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation and acidic citrus zesty aftertaste.

Draft 8 oz pour at Special Brews, a day late for the birthday party. Ill get you next time bud! Shiny golden pour with a ton of foam head. Dusty, citrus fruit and grain aroma, with a tart promise. Flavor is tart lemon and other citrus fruit, some orange, and a dry, lingering tart fruit finish. A biting dry bitterness to it, that I kinda like here. Quality beer here, and a very fun try.

Draft at SB. Happy birthday, S! Pours a slightly hazy bright orange amber with a loose white head thats gone pretty much right away. Bright tangy nose, citric, funky, bit of barnyard, bits of orange and grapefruit, hints of basement. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Barnyard, wet hay, oranges, grapefruits on the mid palate. Long dry slightly funky finish. Amazingly potent in aroma and flavor given the lower ABV.
Clear orange pour with lasting thin white head. Aroma is musty sweet old fleshy fruit. Taste is lemon, funk and tart. Really like this.

Sample from tap at In de Wildeman during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016 hazy golden/yellow with a small white head. Aroma of cheese, sour, wood, some nice acidic complexity. Taste has some nice sourness levels, soft, balanced, sweet, fruity, sour aftertase, medium body, nice.

Sampled from tap at In de Wildeman during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016. Hazy, golden amber with an off-white head. Sourish-fruity, slightly funky aroma of lemon, rhubarb, some barnyard and oak. Very sour, fruity and moderately funky taste of lemon, rhubarb, some barnyard and oak, followed by a medium long, very tart and dry finish. Thin to medium body, very astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good!
On the 10th anniversary of Alibi Room. Pours a slightly hazy blonde. Aroma is earthy, wild notes. Taste is sour, earthy, wild notes. Sour aftertaste. Fresh. Good.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels 20160508. Fruity, bretty and acidic with citrusy notes, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and bretty.
Tap @ moeder lambic brussels. Pours a dark orange colour beer with a small head. Fruity with green apples, apricots and brett. Dry finish

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Light hazy golden with thin fine white head. Apricot, unripe peach, berries, grapes, pits, funky cheesiness, distant hoppiness. Strong sour, medium minerallike/salty. Medium body, light carbonation. Lot of minerallike texture. Very nice.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Almost clear golden with white head made up of very fine white bubbles. Lots of funk, hay, white grapes, gooseberries, white pepper, light sweet malts, touch of lemon. Under medium sour and bitter. Under medium bodied with fine prickly carbonation. Really good. Nothing weird or overly complex, just a really good classic drinkable gueuze. Amazing.

On tap @ Øst, Stavanger. Aroma is tart hay, grass and fruity notes of grapes and stone fruits, as well as bretty wood, cork and farmhouse notes.Full body, with very soft carbonation. Flavour is tart musty wooden brett, nuts, and funky floral notes, as well as some farmyardy notes. Bretty wooden finish. Tremendously balanced and drinkable.

Slightly amber with a fine small off white head. Aromas of light funk, barnyard, sour-fruit esters develop. Light lively, soft and mildly slick with a light body. Very brisk sweetness mounting in a solid dry sourness. Lasting dry sour bit tart finish.

sample from draft at ZBF 16. poured a deep golden to orange colour pretty much flat. nose of citrus notes, green apples, grapefruit, hay, dusty cellar notes, barnyard, funk, tanic. tart sour notes with a lot of funk. dry mouthfeel. but heavy, but very complex. loved it a lotEarlier Rating: 10/25/2014 Total Score: 3.8draft sample. poured a cloudy amber more golden colour with a white head. horse blanket, citrus, lemons, lemon zest, tart, earth, vinegar, green apples, nice funky mouthfeel.
Pours a golden color with a thin white head. Fruit, vinegar and grain aroma and flavors. Light body and moderate carbonation. Tart and fruit finish.
On tap at Beercraft. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Mild tingly sourness. Nice Gueuze bitumen flavor. Noticeable lower alcohol.
Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy golden colour. A nice tart flavour. Subtle sourness that is still sweet. Some apple and grape. Really enjoyable.
Yelow, bronze,light cloudy. Aroma of hay, and leather. Sweet,sour fruity with mild aftertaste
Golden with a white head. Really sour aroma with notes of dust. Champagne-ish palate. Really sour and surprisingly bitter.
Draft at Moeder Lambic. Yeasty aroma of basement and Brett. Light hoppy aroma of hay and floral. The flavour is moderat sour. The body is light and the texture is juicy.

On tap at Moeder Lambics. It pours mostly clear golden with a bubbly white head. Loads of moist cellar notes in the aroma along with citrus and barnyard. Acidic flavor with citrus and horse blanket notes. Long citric acidic almost zesty finish.
Clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is oak, lemon and cheese . Taste is lemon, oak and grapefruit
On tap @ Proletariat NYC. Pours clearish gold, med fluffy white head. Aroma is oak, grass, lemon, funk. Flavor is dry lemon, grain, oak, barnyard, musty funk, wood. Great!

Ive enjoyed this beer at the IMBC and at Moeder Lambic in Fontainas, Brussels.

AROMA: Lemongrass, very light easy, floral, barnyard.

APPEARANCE: Very light bodied, straw coloured. Light and wispy head.

TASTE: A lighter version of the bottle version lets say. A little less complex. Gorgeous sour yet without being overly complex if that makes sense? Its a cracking idea and concept. 

PALATE: Quenching, watery, salty, lasting. 

OVERALL: For me this is the ultimate session Gueuze and my intro to the blendery at the IMBC  2015 and Ive since fallen in love. Top quality Gueuze for the everyday. I wish this was in every pub.

On-tap in De Bierboom for the 4th International Beer Swap on 5th Feb 2016. Almost clear pour, golden in colour with a wispy head. Sour apples in the aroma and tart taste. Not too intense like the stronger, bottled version, this is almost enjoyable and drinkable.
pale light-golden, average white head, funky smell, thin mouthfeel, little sourness, some malt notes, citrus fruit, fizzy carbonation

Draft at akkurat 
Hazy, yellow orange minimal head 
Aroma of cellar and citrus, apricots,
Sour, fresh, citrus orange cellar. Lovely 
Fizzy nice

Draft at The Avenue Pub, New Orleans. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is funk, green apple, and fruity. Similar taste as aroma, fairly sour. Picked up something like burnt malt, though. Not bad.

Aroma: not sure -- perhaps old beer bottles? Appearance: straw with billowy head that dissipates quickly; Taste: sour; tastes better than the smell; similar to Saison Brett but more funky; Chardonnay-like; Palate: medium body with dry, grapey finish; Overall: not my favorite.

From tap at Bøker & Børst with BHK 30.12.15. Slightly hazy pale golden. Small off-white head. Pure and clean lambic aroma and taste, acid, hints of citrus and unripe apples. Moderate bitterness. Very dry

Pour on tap at HopCat, clear golden pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of tart lemon, cheese, funk, oak, dust,slight earthy notes. Taste was a mix of oak, funk, slight lemon, vanilla into a bit of earth, some cheesy notes, finishing tart, funky. Delicious.

Weekend of Tartness 2015 - The Scratch Bar. Golden peach pour - looks beautiful. Aroma is stonefruit n funk - popping! Taste is the same with a strong citrus presence. Lovely lambic and a real treat to have it on tap in Oz.
Glass in moeder lambic. Pours cloudy amber. Grape, gooseberry, white wine nose. Sour, dry, white wine grape, gooseberry flavour. Nice.
Tap@ Stadin panimobaari. Hazy amber, thin white head. Aroma has tartness, apricots, green apples. Flavor has tartness, apricots, apples, sourness, grapes. Tart finish. Really good.
Gold pour with a white head. Dry, florals, sour, lightly acidic, tart and funky. Great palate, funky, tart, acidic, farmhouse, funk, smooth finish.

Tap @ Man in the Moon. Hazy golden, small white short lastning head. Tart aroma, orange, lemon, green apples. Light and sour mouthfeel kind of sticks to my teeth. Nice tart taste, lemon, green apple, stables, wood, hay. Rich fruity finish that lingers after the sour taste.
Blond with fluffy head. Funky aroma. Flavour is funky and tart with a woody dryness in the finish.

From tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussel. Aroma of fruits, zesty citrus, Brett funk, green apples, hint of malt, wood. Flavour is medium sour with a dry finish. Body is medium, carbo is lively. Nice sessionable version of the Gueuze.

Hazy golden color. The nose shows chestnuts and burnt oak with cat piss and decent sourness. Good smokey sour notes, oak,
Light body, low carbonation big sourness. Excellent .
Tap @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Tart, straw, funk, apples. Another great beer from Tilquin.
Draft moeder. Thanks vindueskigger :D. Pours hazy orange, with a white head. Aroma of barn, funk. Grape, complex, grassy. Very complex. Balanced.
Draft at Moeder Lambic! Pours hazy dark golden, with a white head. Aroma of barnyard, grass, citrus, oak. Omg, so well balanced!!! Potent brett and funk, really nice tartness, citrus, stone fruits.

Keg at IMBC 15. Hazy orange with a thin white cap. Very wild and funky aroma. Some white fruits in there. Taste has a sour hit with some dry woodiness coming through in the finish. Its too long since Ive had the regular version to make a comparison but this is a perfectly fine gueuze.
On tap at Ölrepubliken. Clear golden with small head. Sour, funky with gay and leaves. Dry with high sourness, medium bitterness and no carbonation.

Keg at IMBC 2015. 

Good-looking, honey-coloured beer with an initially very large, white head that soon falls ways. The nose is powerfully sour, with some underlying floral notes. The taste is very sour, with a slight burnt flavour to it, which as a stretch could be described as barbecued fruit. A little sweetness lingers on the palate, making the aftertaste quite pleasant, but the overall effect is too sour for me. I appreciate that this may be a taste that I havent yet acquired, but I dont currently see what all the fuss is about.
IMBC 2015 Pours a pale colour. Taste is sour and musty with yeast, apples and some farmhouse aromas

Keg at Indy Man Beer Con. A slightly hazy deep golden colour with a thick, foamy white head. Aroma of barnyard funk, straw, apple, white grape, some orange, slight grass and wet wood. Taste of tart green apple, white grape, orange peel, subtle pear, some barnyard funk, grass, wood and lemon zest. Medium bodied and an oily texture. A dry, moderately sour, funky citrus finish. A great Gueuze, very citrusy and the yeast is very distinct. Lovely beer.

Draught at Pigalle. Greta stuff, round mouthfeel with sour apple and grape, herbal and lemon notes, touch of oak, good dose of funk, dry finish. Pretty outstanding sour brew even though I found the bottle version more complex.

Pours bright orange with a foamy one and a half finger off white head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of overly ripe sour fruits, wet hay, barnyard funk, band aid, dirt, mushroom like notes, grass, fermenting fruits, oak, and some woody tannins. Taste is overly ripe sour fruits, wet hay, barnyard, oak, wood tannins, earthy mushrooms, soft cheese rind, citrus, grass, and some vinager. Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and a bone dry, pretty sour, long, lingering finish. Overall, a fantastic guezue that is complex and refreshing.

On keg at the Grove, Huddersfield. I was more excited to try this than to actually drink it, if you know what I mean. Pretty rare, but I prefer the normal version - its got more gusto. I always find bottled gueuze to have better carbonation - it seems necessary to the style for me to have this lively lasting bubblyness. This is still really good and complex. Seems a bit more lemony and fruity and dry and less funky than the normal version. Apples, peach, lemon, bitter. Zesty!

On tap at The Birch, Norfolk VA for Zwanze 2015. Pours hazy dark orange with small finger of head. Nose is classic Tilquin, skunky herbal stonefruit, fuzzy orange, dry weathered wood, old barn. Taste is great with more of the flavors found in the nose and a balanced medium tartness. Finishes with dry dusty baked wood, tannic, weed, stonefruit, orange rind, herbal. Possibly a hair better than the bottled version. Delish!

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Pours a clear, slightly hale yellow with a decent, white head. Aroma is fruity, lemony, barnyard, light sour, light sulphur and appleskin. Taste is dry and sour. Appleskin, barnyard, barnyard gets stronger on the finish. Surprisingly fruity. Long aftertaste. Light.

On tap @fine mousse. An almost clear copper beer with low head. Nose is on fruit such apricot, tart notes, sourish almond. Aroma is malty, tart, bitter almond, wet herb, wet wood, nutty, background bitterness, pleasant and very drinkable, less dry and sour than the average of lambic, but too watery.

Tap at Pigalle. Pours a slightly hazy deep gold almost amber with a huge soapy white head. Wonderful gooseberry aromas with some grass, young strwaberry and light woodiness. Taste is quite similar with great carbonation and a light lemon zest flavor that is thirst-quenching. Nice and crisp, dry finish. Wonderful and fresh.

Tap @ BBF14. Pours hazy amber with a small white head. Aromas of tart green apples, citric, slight vinegar, barnyard and funk. Taste is very sour up front, green apples and more vinegar, funk, straw and hay.

Has a fine gueuze aroma with sour lemon and hay funk. Great head and a good foggy copper with slight carbonation. Flavour is a nice sour citrus and grass, mighty refreshing. Dry finish. Its a great gueuze and a joy to try one like this again.

27th July 2015Mother Kellys. Keg. Hazy gold amber beer, a thin and short lived cream colour head. Palate is dry and mildly crisp. A nice lemony wet wood thing kicks off, not to sour - nice. But the back end ruins it with a distinctly soapy and over dry finish. Bleh! Gave the rest of my glass to someone else.
Pours cloudy orange with low white head. Aroma of apples, grass, green grapes. Taste is rich fruity tart with a citrusy finish. Body is light and crisp with soft to average carbonation.

Pours golden with foamy marshmallow head. Intense aromas of funk, horse blanket, eggs. Flavours are funky and stinky. Wonderful. So Damn good. Sour funky and bitter.Earlier Rating: 7/11/2015 Total Score: 3.8Very nice. Aromas of dust, chalk, rhubarb and funk. Nice sour flavours. Earthy, sour and wonderful.

On tap at MoederLambic. Orange body white lasting head . Funky earthy eggs and blue cheese on the nose. Shato vinegar sour and a milky sweetness , smooth palate. Great beer.Earlier Rating: 7/12/2015 Total Score: 3.8On tap at MoederLambic . Yellow body white head. Chalk dust aroma with notes of nuttiness . Nicely sour with a touch of sweet to balance it out. Great gueze.

Tap at Moeder Lambic, Fontainas, Brussels. Poured a hazy straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is caramel, biscuit, acid citrus, yeast. The flavour is moderate sour with a gorgeous, smooth, crisp acid citrus, light yeast palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation.
ath zythos beer festival along with Yves golden blond colored body with a white head and a sour fruity hop aroma a sour fruity bitter hops taste with a dry bitter finish
Draft at Moeder - Pours orange/yellow. Nose is lemony, tart, grassy, spicy. Taste is lemony, tart, acidic.

This slightly less complex, yet much more sessionable draught version of the stellar gueuze offers an inviting crash course in natural lemonade-style fruity tartness of fresh squeezed lemons and the odd green apple peel thrown in, combined with a quenching, but not lipsmacking dryness and invigourating effervescence. Teasing wine vinegar prickles, kept in check. Not as much funky complexity, cheesy notes as their special blend lambics, but straight-up light & summery goodness, rounded off with a nice astringent old hop note. Would have this on draft more regularly if only available anywhere in the civilised world outside of the blending halls perimeter.

Fast klare kräftig goldene Farbe, geinge weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch trocken, säuerlich fruchtig, pelzig, holzig. Geschmack ziemlich sauer, holzig, pelzig, Kraut, zum Ende nimmt die Säure deutlich ab, gut!

Keg at The Cask. Session geuze yeah! Nothing much to add other than this is slightly lighter version of one of the classics. Easily drinkable all day. Lovely dry mild sourness with oodles of dusty character.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 On tap at Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Pours a slightly hazy golden color, topped with a fairly small white head. Earthy, cellar aroma, with soury cider-like quality. Taste follows the aroma - some fruity notes at first, soury taste with earth notes. Some herbal feel to it in the end. A really decent one.

Geuze on tap, but the brewer eagerly explained to me that according to the definitions, it still qualifies as an oude geuze, since lambic are simply blended in kegs to referment. Interesting... Thin but stable, snow white head, misty golden blonde colour. Lovely aroma of white grape peel, old sherry, hay, green apple, yoghurt, some wet leather, lemon zest... Crisp and very refreshing taste with sharpish apple acidity, lime and softer, sweetish fruits, background wheat sourishness, medium carbo, medium body, long and dryingly tart finish with all the lambic complexity, bit woody, very quenching. As good as any traditional geuze, but perhaps a bit less seasoned, complex and mature than a geuze from the bottle.
Shared with wim at Zythos bierfestival 2015. Clear blond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation. Fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet fruited sour. Nice!

On tap. Pungent lambic burnt match and white grape aroma. Slightly hazy light orange with little white wisps. Very dry, sour beer with less burnt match than aroma. Gentle pickle juice, woody white grape, crisp and watery clean finish. Light body, moderate carbonation, mouth puckering.

Aroma is an earthiness, funkiness, sour grapes and vinegar. Taste is again a funkiness, heavy acidity and vinegar. Finishes tangy. Appearance is a cloudy gold/orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

On tap. Pours a hazy gold with very little head. Aromas of barnyard, apples, peaches, and cheese. Flavors of apples, pears, and apricots with a bit of malt and citrus. A little less tart, but smoother and creamer than the bottled version.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 Heavy funk, earthy, barnyard, lighly sour, lemony with a very light feel to it, not as carbonated, but significantly bigger funk.
Golden color with little foam. A bit weird smell. The sourness is perfect with little but fitting carbonation. The aftertaste is a bit strong but the sourness convinces.

On tap at Moeder Lambic. Golden color with small white head. Barnyard funk, old cheese, apples and lemons, just like it should be! Taste is intense wood, more barnyard funk, more fruits, very dry, nice carbonation. Damn. I love it!

January 23, 2015. On tap at Moeder lambic Fontainas. 
Hazy orange with a large white head. Aroma is funky, earthy, light woody and some citrus and faint egg notes. Taste is tart citrus, earthy and dry oaky notes with a herbal touch. Light bodied, a bit sticky carbonation

(On tap @ Akkurat, Dec 29 2014) Pours a lightly cloudy pale orange with small white head and no lace. Aroma of lemon peel, light orange, lightly lactic, wheat malts, musty herbal notes, lightly woody, maybe a hint of horse blanket too? Tap at hops and pie. Cloudy yellow with a small foamy white head. Smells of citrus, funk, yeast and some earthy notes. Flavor is tart citrus, light funk and yeast. Light bodied, acidic with dry end.

Aroma: Nose is lightish, with some bretty yeast, wood, and citrus/lemon

Appearance: It pours a clear golden-yellow color with an average sized white head

Palate: The body is medium, it has a pretty nice drinkability, and a sharp, tart finish

Draught: Served in a thin tall tumbler:

Delicious beer!

Gold pour, white head. Big aroma of barnyard and fruit. Flavor of straw, grapefruit and barnyard. Great effervescent body.

Lightly hazed yellow pour with no head. Aroma is acidic with paper. Very dry medium acidic flavor with a papery finish. Medium body and thin.

On tap at Appalachian Vintner in Asheville. Pours a yellow color with white head. Fresh, lemon, tart flavors. Nice.

On tap at the Pine Box. Tart citrus, green apples, Belgian yeast, oak, old wine. Funky, big, dry. Nice lingering bitter finish.

Tap at CBC Clerkenwell cheers to Ben, pours golden almost flat and with little to no head what-so-ever. Sour pears, pickled eggs, musty niceness. Never rated a lambic before, drunk them before being on RB.

Cask engine at Lord Hobo, 1/26/14White head is fluffy and well-retained, atop a bright orange/gold body with light carbonation. Clear.Plentiful orange and light acetic acid in the nose. Touches of sulfur and a hint of sweetness. Tons of brett (band aid and light green apple).Cantillon similarity in the flavor, of course, but as Joris points out, it ends a bit abruptly (the flavor). The sourness and tartness taper off in to just a lingering acetic-like acidity on the palate. Watery, as would be expected, and very drinkable. Nothing particularly different from the bottled version. Just a little lighter and with less funk/depth. Pretty standard for most draught gueuzes Ive had.  Admittedly, a very uninspired rating here, but having just reviewed the bottled version, I dont have much to add.

Un nez hyper frais de citron et dherbes croustillantes enveloppé dune sauvagerie aigu. Un soupçon lactique se mélange gracieusement dans ce corps svelte et cassant pour donner une buvabilité indiscutable. Jen boirais des litres avec de la pieuvre grillée!

Clear light orange. Whispy white head, slight lacing. Aroma of sour apple. Sips medium and quite sour. Dry and clean finish. Mostly grape and apple flavors. A little outdoorsy/pine tree like hint underlying in there. Had off tap at Bottleworks in Wallingford as my 1st beer there.

Keg at Cask PK. Hazy orange, small white head, very lightly sparkling. Smell - lots of lemon, slight barnyard. Body is medium, carbonation medium. Taste - acidic lemon juice, tart and sweet, the barnyard theme continues, dental rinse, wet cardboard, mineral-heavy white wine. In comparison to other gueuzes, the sourness is soft and its not overly sweet. Finishes crisp, dry and musty. The best aspect for me is the malty, musty finish after all that sweetness/sourness. Good.

Honestly, I prefer this in the bottle. Draft to Tilquin glass (proper glassware). Beautiful pour. Golden halo in color. Surprisingly nice head! Nice fruit nose that begs you to take a sip. Mouthful of apricots on taste. Unfortunately, the abv and punch in the face taste in the bottle isnt quite as noticeable on tap. Would I drink again, hell yea I would!!!

Hazy yellow, thin white head. Nose is funk, tart lemons, hay, a touch of chlorine. Taste is tart and bitter pulpy lemons, more citrus notes, slight funk, somewhat astringent on the finish. Medium mouthfeel, soft light carbonation.

Una gueuze spaziale! Acidità persistente e ammorbidita da note limonose e legnose, che la rendono unottima compagna di serate estive. Leggero sentore dolce, ma non invasivo, che non sfocia nellorrendo sapore sciroppato di molte altre gueuze meno degne. Da gustare e rigustare senza stancarsi!

Had this on tap @ Delirium Taphouse June 20, 2011. Ive been holding these notes for the beer to show up on BA, finally. Served to me in a branded pseudo-pint

A: Yellow golden ale with near excellent clarity. Single finger of bone white foam falls over several moments to a sheet of the same. No lacing. 3

S: Tart and funky. Really dry nose with a good dose of the farmhouse on a hot, stagnant summer day. This is balanced well with a nice lemony citric acidity. 4

T: Nice and tart. Well done gueuze with a balance of fine, musty flavors with a good sour wild punch. Im struggling to really do justice here with the flavor profile as Im writing on a napkin, but this is really good. 4.5

M: light and crisp. A finish that is both dry and satiating. Good. 4

O: Great gueuze. Wish it was stateside. 4

Note: after this, I came to find this beer is now available stateside. I advise anybody into Gueuze to try this out. It reminds me of a mix between 3F and Cantillon Classic gueuzes. A really nice beer.

Serving type: on-tap

09-15-2011

Draft at Moeder Lambic. Pours cloudy golden with an off white head. Aroma is cheese, barnyeard, tropical fruits, grassy and yeast. Taste is heavy sour and light sweet. Average body with soft carbonation.

[10/7/13] Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas in Brussels. Hazy deep golden with a nice big rocky off-white head. Nice funky aroma with oak, lemon, leathery notes and some barnyard. Sour flavor, oaky and lemony, with some barnyard and a hint of astringent bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied. Great and very refreshing.

Tap. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that was lasting with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour, barnyard, cheese aroma. Medium to full body with a dry texture with soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour flavor with a medium sour finish of moderated to long duration. This is a interesting solid for style beer.

Draft to taster at Dutchs Stinky Cheese and Sour Beer event. Looks good; a semi-transparent light golden orange with thin off-white lacing. Smells of barnyard, funk, and oak. Tastes like it smells, only not quite as robust. Nice on the palate. Good beer.

On tap at Dutchs. This stuff is a bitch to pour, very foamy, but once the foam dies down, whats left is just fantastic. Totally hazy golden orange color, thin off-white head, good dots and ropes of lace. Lighter body, light crisp carbonation. Lightly sticky sticky in the finish. Very easy drinking and refreshing. Oaky, lemon citrus flavors, light on the funk, and a good tart sour taste overall. Very enjoyable stuff. Very clean, easy drinking geuze.

Draft at Moeder Lambic, 09/29/2013. Golden pour, creamy layer of head rests on the surface, a ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is bright, musty apricot, peach, lemon overtones and white grape, horse blanket funk, oak. Taste follows suit- apricot, peach and orange, tart, with touch of grape and apple, sour malts, a funky mellow finish, very round. Light body, spritzy, very drinkable. This one surprised me, really nice.
Poured from tap. Cloudy yellow color, small diminishing white head. Slight aroma of vinegar and fruit. Lip smacking tart flavor, medium body.
Not much of a head, slightly hazy, yellow colour. Mild aroma of plums.Wonderful flavor,astringent taste, effervescent and refreshing.

25cl draft at Moeder (with a sidecar of grain). Hazy orange color with a huge meringue head. Classic funky and tart aroma. That is just good gueuze and Im not a huge fan of the style. I could drink a lot of this.
Hazy, golden, hardly any head, some surprising notes of apple, not as good as Cantillons, but pretty good anyway.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Pours a murky orange on tap with lots of bubbly carbonation but no real head or lacing. Aroma of sour fruit and a dirty funk. Taste is a dry sour tart fruitiness with a lasting bite on the tongue. Pretty damn good, very easy to drink.

Nose of hay, grass, gueuze funk, dried barnyard grains. Lemon lime tartness, bitterness tinge from the yeast, layer of funk across the tongue makes mouths happy. Peppery yet soft carb up front; they nailed the mouthfeel here. Think I like this better than the bottles.
One day a baby bird went to buy a Ferrari and it tripped on the way to the bakery. He never did find his real father . Shame.
On trap at Patricks. Pours hazy golden with a white. Aromas of stable, funk, lemon, acid and wood. Flavor is sweet and sour with lemon, wood, sour berries and oak. Medium body, average carbonation.

Served on-tap at Monks Cafe


A - Pours cloudy golden amber with a one finger tall white head leaving spotty trails of lace down the glass.


S - Smells of musty basement funk, light fruitiness, damp earth, apple skins and some light acidic sourness. This draught version has quite a bit more funk than the bottles I have come across.


T - Starts off with the musty funk and fruitiness from the nose but it is much more restrained in the taste while the acidic sourness levels are ramped up a bit. Hints of grass, green apples and some light sweetness round things out. Finish is pretty dry, lingering on the palate long after the finish.


M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Dry, crisp feel throughout.


O - I liked this version. It has all of the flavors I would expect it to have and it is easy to consume. A little too pricy to have all of the time but every now and then is fine with me.
Soft sulfur note, earthy. Slighty hazy medium amber color. Nice sour note, assertive but not overpowering or overwhelming. Clean and tart, a sulphur note, clean finish and aftertaste.

Tap (Tuulensuu, Tampere) (8:4:4+:4:15=3.8+)
Heavently gueuze aroma. Lovely crisp palate. Some apricot, not as much as yesterdays Girardin White Label bottle. A super mellow gueuze, but not lacking sharpness either. A refreshing smack in the chops. Finish has a lovely wheatiness, and is a touch fruity. A great gueuze.

Draught at Delirium. Cloudy gold, fine low head. Dusty leather and grapefruit nose, horse blanket. Fresh. Tangy grapefruit and lemon flavor, dusty, blanket. Crisp and refreshing. Not super complex but lovely and easy drinking.

(Keg at Gastropub Tuulensuu, 20130810) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, wood, vomit and grapefruit. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, wood, fruitiness, grapefruit and bitterness. Aftertaste was sour, woody and bitter. Weaker than the bottle version but still a good one.

Poured hazy dark straw with fizzy white head. Nose is lactic fruit, yeasty funk. Tastes tart, earthy, funky, yeasty, with a high level of tartnesswith more lactosy sweetness mixed with the heavy fruit and funk.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours yellowish with a big white head, but that might be the taps fault. Aroma is sour funk, some light vinegar. Taste is rather sour. Body is nice with a sort of seltzer finish. Tasty if you are into the gueuze.
Draught at Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of bitter lemon, yeast. Flavour is bitter, sour, citric.

draft @ gollem antwerp. 
pours blonde, fading white head. smell is dry and sour . 
good carbo , very dry, sour apples. medium for the style

On tap at Tørst. Super pungent on the nose, fresh and sour. Pours like an apple cider. Incredible sour, lots of apple at the finish. Awesome

Well hello cheese! !!! Nose and taste.... draft a t torst.. very noce geuze, balanced cheese, sour
on tap-tight white head-hazy yellow/gold. A-some funk, yeast, lt malt. T-funk, yeast, lt malt.
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, straw, barnyard, funk and hops.

Several samples from tap@ Delirium, Brussels. Foggy golden with and orangey shade. Small white head. Crisp lemony fruit aroma. Light funk, light mineralic. Light body, sparkling and fresh in the mouth. Fresh citrussy flavor. Some cellar notes, light funk and hint of leather and stable. Dry sour-acidic fruit finish. Highly drinkable and utterly refreshing. [20.04.13]

Tap @ The BeerMongers Sour Showcase... Poured hazy, golden amber/yellow. Nice funk on the nose. Some malty sweetness with funk, acidic tartness and light fruits that were citrus-like. Awesome drinking beer and so much flavor for the lower alcohol. Some musky farmhouse yeast funk in the finish.

TAP at Delirium cafe Brussels. Shared with Mathieu87. 
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, little to no foam, little white rim.
NOSE: brett, horse blanket, nice sourness, very little barnyard, nice nose in total.
TASTE: nice and sour, goes down well, brett aftertaste, nice sourness, very easy drinkable, amazing geuze in total.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2013 Keg in Craft Beer Co. Colour is beautiful toasty amber with cloudiness, thin white bubbley head. Nose is Lots of burnt rubbery sour, funky, light farmyard, citric lemony. Taste is light rubbery, lemon, nice sour, tangy appley fruit with that lip smacking sourness. Great balance and really refreshing.

On tap. Mutiple samples at The Festival, side-by-side with the bottled version. Yellow pour with huge white head. Aroma leans more towards funk and wood than citrus. Way smoother while the bottled version is more pungeant and intense. I slightly prefer the bottled version but this is nonetheless a nice tweak.

On draft @ Novare Res Bier Café. Hazy golden with small diminishing white head and little lacing. Aroma is fresh with lemon, funk, barnyard, light apple and herbal notes. Taste is slightly sweet with lemon, funk, brettanomyces, barnyard, green apple and light berries notes. Light to medium body. Fresh, crisp and dry mouthfeel. Very complex and extremely refreshing. As good as the bottle version. Maybe a tad less complex, but as refreshing (if not more)! I would drink tons of this!

On draught at roscoes - nose of green apple, yeast. Cloudy copper color. Taste of tart apple with dry finish. Has quite a sour aftertaste - could be due to my meal though!

Hazy yellow with a small white head. Lovely aroma of funk, wood and grapefruit. Dry and mild tart flavour with funk and grapefruit notes. A bit thin in the mouthfeel
On draught at Apex. Murky golden color. Aroma of sour apple and funk. Fruity sour taste, with intense lambic features. Ticklish finish.

Draft at Delirium Café Brussels. Clearish golden yellow with a frothy white head and good lacing. Aroma of citrus, funky barnyard, wood and vinegar. Flavor is tart, acidic and citrusy with mild hop bitterness. Light body with a dry mouth feel. Excellent beer, very light but lots of well-balanced sour and tart character.
Veyr good and sour. I liked it and was in a glass. GOlden features and crafty character had also.

(draught) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of lemons and light peaches, with a hint of black pepper, dandelions and banana. flavour is mostly heavy lemons and white bread, with notes of strawberries, bubble gum and a slightly minerally finish. light-bodied with lively carbonation.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, 29/04/13.
Clear golden with a good sized white head.
Nose is grass, farmy notes, citrus, wood, light smoke.
Taste comprises neat lime cordial, grass, lemon, light funk, touch of sugar, barn door.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Cracking revitalising stuff!

On tap at Moeder Lambic. Pours a near clear golden color with a lofty white head that falls to a fluffy blanket. Smell is pungent lemon, tart funk on the nose. Taste is nice lemon, tart mild funk, finishes tart and dry. Light body and slightly below average carbonation level.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas,  pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of mild horse blanket and moderate barnyard funk. Flavour is similar, with moderate barnyard funk, horse blanket and some subtly tart notes. Moderately funky, with medium horse blanket notes. Excellent stuff.

Tap @ ZBF 2013.
Pours hazy yellow with a big, creamy, white head. Aroma is nice, citrus, apple, funk and tartness. Medium to low carbonation, fine light mouthfeel. Flavour is sweetish tart, citrus, clear lactic. Slightly metallic and lingering mild tartness.
Helt underbart balanserad med syra. Skulle kunna svepa hela skiten direkt och samtidigt njuta av varje klunk om man så ville
2013.04.27 - zythos bierfestival leuven -  as good as it is, i still prefer their regular oude geuze tilquin à lancienne

UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 Draught.. obviously. Light copper, slight haze. Steady barnyard, hay, light malts. A bit of apples, general funk. Very nice nose. Body is light, tart, dry. Tart red apple pie, horseblanket. Very nice draught.

Pours hazy amber in color with a small whitish head. Some horseblanket, a bit of old vinegar and notes of light sourness in aroma. Doesnt feel that aggressive, which is a bit of a shame. Tart mouthfeel nontheless, some apples and a bit of some wooden notes in taste. Something is missing in this version, not as good as the bottled one, seems a bit tamed thats all. Sure the tartness and sourness is there, but it just doesnt feel that refreshing and tasty on the whole.
@ Moeder Lambic Fontanas. Hazy orange colour. A nice acidic geuze.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. The pours hazy amber with a light head. The nose is lemon rind, notes of sweet condensed apple juice. Sweet and inviting aromas. The taste is more of the same. Nice apple fruit leather sweetness with a balancing lemon acidity on the finish. Hints of woody brett and barnyard. Light body, super refreshing. Overall, excellent.

Toer de Geuze 2013
I guess this is the one I had during the tour. They said its before the second fermentation with no sugar. Interesting beer with sourness as its main characteristic.

On tap at Patricks. Its a lightly hazy, golden-orange beer with some white head. The aroma is lightly leathery, with barnyard, citrus peel, dusty cellar and a generic fruityness. Dry and tart on the palate, lightly carbonated. Fruity flavor, funky and citrusy. Lasting finish. A really nice and easy drinkable one. Sure a nice one. 130408

On tap @ Grunerløkka Brygghus. Actually served in its proper glassware. Its deep blurry golden in color and the head is not to big, not to lacing and what I would call just off-white in color. Lovely aroma with sour berries, brett, gymnastic socks and some wood. It smell quite intriguing this. About average on the carbonation and light oily on the mouthfeel. Lovely refreshing flavors, not the least to sour, lots of gooseberries, sour red currants before I get something almost cheese like. A lovely beer, but I prefer the bottled version as this feels more acidic, fresh and flavorful. 02.03.2013

On tap @ Patricks. Hazy yellow/orange body with a small, dense white head. Fine, smooth, kind of right funky aroma. Flavor is refreshing acidic, relatively smooth and fruity. True to the style and should not offend anybody at the same time. A perfect beer for a nice summer day. Not very different from the bottle version but I have not compared them side by side.
On tap at Patricks. Deep golden colour with a white head. Aroma is funk, orange, yeast, fruit, brett. Flavour is funk, orange, yeast, citrus, fruit, brett, wood. Nice beer.

It was the first true patio Friday happy hour of the year in Atlanta today.  Thus, I had a hankering (is it hankerin?) for a refreshing low abv beer.  This gueze was on the mark.  It poured the color of dried out orange rind.  It had a brilliant effervescence in my mouth.  There was a touch of an unpleasant acidic aftertaste, but overall great flavor.  My experience with the gueze style is limited to maybe 5-6 drinking sessions, thus, I have little to compare this to.  Would definitely grab again on a warm day.  Draft - Leons - Decatur, GA

A golden color with a white head. Aroma contains some vinegar, lemons, a bit funky. Flavor is sour with vinegar, lemons, and grassy notes. This is not punch you in the sour but still a guezue nonetheless. Overall very nice beer and worth the price.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas.... Zwanze day 2012.. It pours hazy golden with a small white head.... The aroma is tart, sour and fruits... The flavor is fruity, hay, straw and sour and tart.....

Draught @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, tart, barnyard, horse blanket and fruity. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour with a long sour and dry finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Lovely gueuze that would be perfect on a hot day outside. With the dryness and tart savour of a cider and moderate strength this is awesome.
150315. Tap at Juovonsuu, Tampere. Pours clear cider like golden with almost no head. Aroma ripe fruit, berries. Slight tart taste. Not Bad.

It pours deep gold with an slight orange hue and supporting a thin near white head of foam. The aroma is on the bright side with lemon like tartness, sour sweetened vinegar and mild funk off in the background. The taste is vibrant yet restrained, crisp and refreshing where Im getting soured citrus and smooth somewhat sweetened up vinegar and then a thin ring of acidic citrus like tartness. This hits the mark as it is refreshing and ends dry and crisp and pushing you toward taking another taste. Nice vibrant yet easily sessionable brew.

Golden pour at the Alehouse.  Craggy white head dissipates quickly.  Aroma is faintly horsey with sour hay and cool basement.  Tart and crisp, this is a mild gueuze that is soft and refreshing.  As it warms a bit it becomes a bit more puckering and some ripeness emerges as well.  Still, a bit too clean on the finish - I like my gueuzes to linger a bit.  However, overall a good example and - Best of all - available on tap in Mass.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Draft at Monks and Bainbridge St, pours a super hazy glowing orange gold color. Thin white head, light lacing if any. Aromas and flavor of oak, lemons, barn, wet wood. Not super complex on tap for gueuze but a really nice option when 3 Font and Cantillon are sparse. Cheers.
On tap at Teresas. Pour gold with quickly dissipating white head. Barnyard, musty, lemon. Very sour. Mildly sweet. LIvely body. Excellent.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of vinegar and grapefruits. The flavor is sweet with an acidic edge and primary notes of grapefruits, but also light notes of horseblanket, leading to a tart finish.

Sampled at Of Love & Regret - Pub & Provisions; January 2013
The beer arrives from the tap with a lightly hazed, gold color. It is topped by a pale, head.  The aroma smells tart, with lactic acid notes, and with touches of urea. There is quite a bit of fruit character in the nose as well, and this is backed by an earthy grain character that has notes of dried straw / hay to it.

The flavor is not nearly as sour  as I was expecting; there is a definite tartness here but it is fairly soft, especially for a Gueuze / Lambic. This has a hay like grain character to it and it is lightly funky with an earthy, sort of musky character to it.

This is definitely quite a bit different from the bottled product; it needs more sourness, but it is still quite good in the end. It has more of an earthy & funky character to it than biting tartness, but in honesty, even the former is held well in check; clean, would be a good way to describe this. Somehow comes off as being a bit like a tamed Gueuze and I wonder if not being bottle conditioned has an effect on this (but I cant see that being the total explanation here).

Draught in a flute. Pours a hazy golden color with a moderate white head. Nose has sour fruity elements to it, and the taste is much the same, with a bit of a bite to it. As a whole, it reminds me of a dry champagne, with the bubbly feel and all.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Draft at Monks then later at Eulogy. Poured a hazy pale peach. Large bright white head that left some lace. Strong sour. Citrus and amber fruits. Nectarines. Peaches. Plums. Lemons. Limes. Chardonnay. Gentle  caramel sweetness fuzzes out the edges just a bit. Fuller body than one would expect for a gueuze. Sharp and fruity. Complex but not subtle.
Buttery at first sip but it turns into a lemony sour but pleasant brew. Nto super funky. VEry nice.

Color is like honey: bit hazy yellow, thin layer of creamy head and lacing. Strong funky aroma has ripe berries (blackcurrant), yeast, bit spicy. Quite sour flavor, dry, soft feel and low carbonation, long sour and aromatic finish with berries and citrus, medium body. Flavor-kick to those who enjoy it. Works fine for me at least between the mild ones.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. It pours a yellow colour with a medium white head. Aroma is nice with citrus, dust and oak. Taste is very dry and lemony with some green apple and tangerine tartness. Very citrus forward gueze. It has a really well balanced acidity with oak and a dry, mildly leathery finish. I love me some Tilquin.

On draft at State Line Liquors tasting.  Pours a golden yellow color with a two finger white rocky head and a bit of lacing. Sharp, tart funky aroma loaded with straw, barnyard, and lemon citrus acidity.  The taste is both tart and sour and has earthy flavors from the yeast along with some hints of lemon citrus.  Light body, good carbonation, dry finish.

Cloudy orange and yellow pour. 1 finger pillow like fluffy white head. 
Nose is grassy, lemon and very yeasty.
Taste is very much a watered down version of the bottled gueuze. Still a lot of lemon peel and horsey wet hay funk. Some grass and tart dry finish but this is a gueuze that is not better on draft. Its tilquin with 50% water added

Draft @ Novare Res. Pours a peachy gold with two finger white head that sticks to the glass... Bright aromas of dusty funk and sour lemony fruit even a hint of orange rind. On the palate its solid carbomation delivers a complex barrage of flavors ranging from light soft peach to a dank basement funk ...dusty dry funk bomb on the finish !
Draft @ harvest. It pours with a great white head on top. Wild flavors in mouth and wild at nose. A great geuze! I loved it

Draft at Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Hoo-ha, what a fuckin treat! Its hard to imagine anything better on a warm early evening, and this was so fresh and tart and delectable. Ive actually not yet tried the bottled version, but this young gueuze was more ripe than dry, with tons of fragrant funk and a bit of hay to it. Handsome looking, goes without saying, nicely balanced acetic palate. Finish is awesome, like tart apples and brie.

Light amber golden colour, white head, quite firm for a gueuze. Aroma of rubber, lemon, funk and citrus peel. Tart flavour, sour lemon, citrus peel, light bitter. Quite light body. It feels a bit thin, but that works for this beer, making it very refreshing. Light bitter finish, tart, lingering lemon peel.
Really refreshing beer. Its one of those beers I could drink the whole evening.
(Draught @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas)

Draught, Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Yellowy gold colour with a  nice white head. Funky barnyard and citrus in the nose. Acidic, fruity flavour which steadily dried out. Delicate and soft mouthfeel. Superbly drinkable. Quality stamped all over it. Winner.

On tap @ Spuyten Duyvil for Zwanze Day 2012.  Pours a dark cloudy brass color with a thin and quickly dissipating bone shaded head. The aroma is funky with lemon, apples, champagne yeast, and barnyard. On the plate the tartness is milder than many others in the style. The flavor profile slowly develops and intensifies with green apples, lemons, and a very mild doughy sweetness. The mouthfeel is very round and soft with low acidity.  Loved it.

On tap at Spuytin Duyvil. Pours hazy golden light orange with a white head. Aromas of wild yeast, funk, musky, barnyard, and some apples and grape. Flavors of barnyard, funk, apples, yeast, and a touch of tartness. Body was  nice and full. Really nice.

on draft at st sour day in louisville at the holy grale.  this has a very similar nose to the bottle version, lots of funk from the brett, tons of barnyard and horse nice little hints of the sour goodness inside. this poured a nice golden haze with a solid one finger of frothy white head. the taste of a good gueze is all you get from this, amazing complexity with nice doses of sour in there, its not noticable for the most part that it is 2% lower in abv. the feel is lively and bubbly with mild balanced sour bites. overall wonderful experience and definitely worth it if you ever see it on tap somewhere.

On draft at moeder Lambic Fontainas.

The beer is copper orange, mildly hazy, with a half inch of thick white head that coats the tumbler in lacing. The aroma is bold for the style. Aggressive and forward, more so than the bottled version. Funky, earthy, dank. Light in body with fairly low carbonation. Smooth on the palate initially, finishing zesty with a touch of vinegary sharpness. A tasty brew, I would have this again.

Tasted on tap @Cervereca, Barcelona, on June 2012.
Pours of lovely straw color with a huge head.
Aroma is tart and floral, a bit zesty.
Taste is extra dry and tart, having those barn/grass notes.
Recommended.

A drain pour. Smelled OK but tasted like a sour pear mixed with watered down urine. Horrible.
On draft at bodega. Pours a hazy yellow with a little head. Smells of barnyard. Wild yeast. Taste is sour with hints of apple and hay. Nice and refreshing. Nice beer to start the evening

Tap, PP Dupont. Hazy darker marigold orange with a thin white head. Slightly musty, sharp lemon, grass and intense mineral notes in the aroma. Cobweb, dusty, minerals and a sharp citrus middle ending with a slight bit of cheese.  Lighter body with tiny, tight carbonation.  Superb
had this on draft at akkurat next to mamuce and fu foune on draft! so the beer kind of faded away in the glory of the other ones, but ey a good beer right!?

In short: A tangy/tart gueuze.  Very good but I prefer the bottle version
How: Tap at Grünerløkka Brygghus, Oslo Norway (listed at 4.5% and not 4.8% like currently on ratebeer)
The look: Cloudy dark blond body topped by a small white head
In long: I was expecting a lighter version of the regular Tilquin, but what I got was something more tart, more lemony, more green apples and a bit less funky than the few bottles of Tilquin I drank.  Surprisingly the few bottles I had were easier to drink than this lighter tap version.  Not sure if it was specific to this batch or if the difference between the bottle and draft is always the same, I havent had every batch of the bottle version and certainly not had every batch of the Draft version.  This Tilquin Gueuze Draft Version is a very good beer, but as a true Belgian Lambic it is a little bit below average.  Another lambic I drank in a public place, another opportunity to perfect my Discreet Left Buttcheek Lift Manoeuvre.

draft at Avenue Pub in New Orleans.  hazed gold with a fine white head.  what I remember most about the bottled 2010-2011 version was how powerfully musty and lactic it was, along with the tongue-scraping sourness and prickly acidity; it was strongly minerallic and the yeast was horsey and rustic.  the draft version comes across as less acidic, less sour, less horsey and musty, more sweet and estery with touches of apricot, lemon zest and peach. the body is noticeably thinner (though not too thin) compared to the bottled version, and the finish is less coarse and bold.  its a more delicate, softer, fruitier, less-dry blend.  if this is still only a blend of 1 & 2 year lambic then all of this makes sense.

Draft on tap at Local Option (Chicago, IL) awhile back. Quick stop in on an errands night. Aromas are fresh citrusy oranges, lemons, and vibrant pineapple. Some melon, bread, and dough. Some dry florals are mellow, soft cheese, yogurt. Some light brettiness, some wet oak. Young, gentle funk compliments a vibrant fruity element. Initial is lighter bodied preaching sour lemons and grapefruit, pineapples, and grass. Bread, with soft cheese and yogurt, a touch of a sharp cheesiness cuts in, faint metal, growing citrus and moderate sour fruit element. Its sour, but not acidic, with a good fruity explosion. I dig this, a big fruity sour element, not moving into acidic instead throwing grapefruit, melons, lemons, and good growing sourness, fruit, with a touch of mango, more pineapple really asserts itself. Really nice, some prickly carbonation, jabs of acidity, growing sourness. Mmmmmm. Funk is light, soft, gentle, with just a touch of oak. Some soft cheese and yogurt, playing second fiddle to the fruity sourness for sure. Really nice, wins me over. I preferred the bottled version a touch more.

Taste is nice as well, on the farmy side again, wish it was more tart though, doesnt bring anything new but its very solid

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 pours a very nice light gold color with a good and foamy head.

Excellent aromas of sour oranges, pears, funk tones and some various spices as well. Good depth on the nose with nice complexity.

lighter feel with good flavors and mostly sour oranges and funk tones with some spices.

a really good geuze. Very well balanced on both the nose and palate with just the right amount of funk to it as well.

On tap at City Beer Store.  Pours a hazy light amber with a small white head.  The aroma is light barnyard funk, some light lemon, grapefruit, hay, wheat, and a bit of oak.  Not terribly complex with the flavors being much lighter than in some other lambics.  The initial taste is lemon, going into a bit of funky oak, some light grapefruit, and some hay.  A brett funkiness on the finish with a light tartness.  Light mouthfeel with low carbonation.  You can definitely tell this is younger lambic than most gueuzes.  Ill be curious to try Tilquin gueuzes made from 3 year lambic.  This was enjoyable, but not quite in the class of the great gueuzes.

24/09/2011 Open Baladin Roma (tap). Dorata, lievemente torbida, poca schiuma biancastra, morbida e poco persistente. Aroma di lieviti selvatici, acido, molto armonioso. In bocca è ben bilanciata, morbida e delicata, acida, ma un po troppo corta e leggermente priva di corpo. Gradevole, niente di eccezionale, ma una gueuze fatta con il bilancino, leggera, armoniosa e facile da bere,

It pours light honey amber with a light bubbly white head. The aroma is light sweet candy notes complemented and taken over by the funkand sour notes of the gueze style. The flavor is mellow, balanced, and just the right amount of light juicy tartness to end on the palate pleasantly.

On tap at Beachwood BBQ. Pours with a lightly hazed  golden body and a fluffy white head that is slow to fade. Aromas are floral, musty, honey, white wine, oak, estery, lacto, funky brett, lemony acidity, grape like. Rich funk profile overall. Flavors are richly complex, white wine grapes, dried apricot. Noticeable malt character for a Gueuze (bready and grainy). Acid is a bit more restrained than the bottled version. Good funk, brett, floral, honeysuckle. Lively bubbles, light bodied, dry. Nice!

Draft. Pour is a hazy yellow with a small white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is citric, funky, with white wine vinegar. Taste is fruity, lemon/lime, grapefruit, lacto, funk. Light body, soft, mediun acidity. Good stuff.
Bevuta al Moeder prima e al Villaggio poi, resto dellidea che Tilquin produca una delle migliori gueuze al mondo

Draft. Pours golden amber with a thin head. Tart and funky aroma, with a light citric sweetness and some light flowery notes. The flavor has a light tartness, almosy candy like in its balance of sweetness and tartness, with wheat, funk, floral notes, and a light acidity. Awesome.

Draught at Moeder Lambic, Brussels, for Zwanze Day 2011 as well as the Moeder vs Stone beer festival. Sampled on September 17, 2011Hazy yellow color, white head. Sweet, acidic, stable yard, berry scent. Sweet at first, turns acidic fast, taste. Some lactic and sour notes in the finish and aftertaste. Medium to moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Tart aftertaste.

Draft @ Moeder Lambic Brussels.
Dorée, brumeuse, col épais blanc.
Version similaire que la bouteille, avec en différence, un alcool un peu réduit, mais aussi une bière que je trouvais plus légère et douce que sa consur, cela nenlevant évidement pas du caractère de la gueuze, mais qui pour moi devrait rester en bouteille.
Nez présente un léger arôme boisé, funk/brett et herbacé avec un aspect fruité tropical acidifié, sec et poussiéreux.
Bière sèche, aspect vinaigre et fût de chêne, restant légère au palais, similaire à larôme avec en retrait cette petite touche Cantillon qui reviens pareil que la version en bouteille..

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 On tap at Monks after Zwanze 2011 kicked on Zwanze Day.
A: Hazy-cloudy lemon-yellow body. One inch fizzy white head. Nice stick lacing coated the glass after each sip.
S: Lemon-citric notes. Funky with a nice sweaty, cheesy must. Some hay and barnyard notes. Much more earthy than the bottled offering.
T: Similar notes as in the nose. Clean, acidic lemon plays center stage. Earthy, funk notes fill out the remainder of the flavor profile. The nose, despite the complexity, was better defined. The flavor profile is a little muddled.
M: Medium to light bodied. Moderate carbonation. Semi-dry finish. Moderate acidity. Mild funk in the after-taste.
O: A solid offering. Looking forward to Tilquin continuing in the US market. Hopefully both the draft and bottled offerings are regulars (the bottle offering is better in my book). Its clear Pierre knows what he is doing, so this should continue to improve as he gets more blends under his belt.

Nice citrus fruit with a touch of moldy rind and fresh bread dough. The taste is moderately tart, lightly sweet with grapefruit and orange, light flowers and peach, just a touch of cotton candy. Very nice. Im looking forward to trying more from these guys.

On draft at the Trappist. It pours yellow with a medium sized fizzy white head. The aroma is nice with vanilla, citrus and oak. The flavor is very dry and lemony with some green apple and tangerine tartness. Very citrus forward gueze. It has a really well balanced acidity with oak and a dry, mildly leathery finish. Impressive.

Draft.  Large white head, murky amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, lemon, lacto, some funk.  Taste is medium sweet, lemon/tart, lacto, some barnyard.  Light-medium body, soft, some acidity.  Delicious -- definitely worth the hype.

Draft at Louies Coup in Groppis.  The beer pours to a super hazy straw colored body with a slick creamy starch white head.  The aroma is sour with notes of pineapple and light funky straw.  The flavor is sour mash with some brett funk and acidic sour pineapples.  The palate is sour and yet crisp and clean.  Funky brett.

On draft at the De Heeren 20th Anniversary party during last weeks trip to Belgium. Reviewed from notes.

Served in a HORAL mini tumbler.

Pours a nice golden-yellow color with a good, stable white head and a bit of lacing on the way down.

The nose brought quite a bit of nice funk and bright citrus. Lots of lemon and orange zest and some citric acid. The flavor was very citrusy with light funk and a moderate acidic presence.

Light body with good carbonation and a very dry finish. Nice acidity throughout.

A very impressive beer. I hope to have this more often.

Tap at Rattle n hum - nice lactic notes, caramel malts, delicate fruits - apples and berries. Fizzy body which enhances the impression from the lactic acid, with an edge of acetic. Pretty well balanced, could drink a lot of this stuff. Lacks the complexity of a cantillion offering, but no complaints either.
Hazy Pale Straw with thin white head. Very active carbonation. Sharp yeasty nose. Light body. lemon + brett notes with hint of white wine vinegar. slightly dry lingering finish. Very satisfying

Tap at Churchkey. The pour is a cloudy gold with a diminishing white head. Nose at first is not really hitting all the geuze marks: a little too much white wine and aceto character similar to something like Jolly Pumpkin Bambic. As it warms, sharp nectarine and plum come through with saltwater and plums. With more time the nose opens up into something really spectacular- not as Brett heavy and Cantillon like as I remember the bottled version of this geuze; but actually more Cable Car like its its powerful nectarine, pineapple, plum, and mild white wine vinegar. Very nice. Taste is dry and woody with lemon, white grapefruit, and white wine. Tinge of aceto character. Not as fresh and floral as the bottled version. Still, powerful, salty, spicy, green apple sour, quenching, and lively on the palate. Leathery and softly lactic on the palate. Fruity, leathery, woody. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 Draft at Churchkey. Hazy golden pour with a beautiful frothy head. Nice ose of acidic lemon, tart wheat, hay, a touch of peach, and light basement/cobweb. Flavor holds more tart unripe fruit and lemon; decidedly bright and young for a lambic, as is expected without that 3 year old blended in. Still good carbonation, not too dry on the finish, and pretty solid..... Rerate 2/4/13 draft at Churchkey. Now that the 3 year old is incorporated theres WAY more length and complexity to the flavor. Very very good gueuze.

Tap @ BBF:NOTF.  Nose is lemon, woody, low acidity, quite complex funk - I dont know if Im dreaming but I swear I can pick the cantillon character out of the mix.  Flavor is nice & woody, funky horse blanket brett, lemon, strawberry.  Pithy bitterness.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2011 Splendida gueuze fatta come dio comanda, molto rinfrescante sacrifica un po della complessità della "oude".
Questa gueuze alla spina è davvero meravigliosa, perfetta nellaroma e al palato, complimenti vivi. Non si dimentica...

Draft, Hazy blond coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small white head. Sour sweet hinted aroma with some grainy hints. Full palate. Finish is light sour with a light sour sweet ending. Medium.

Pouring at the Night of the Funk in Boston. Pours a lightly hazed gold with a thin to medium sized white head.  Funky hay, dry funk and musk.  Soft and funky, grows bigger and cheesier.  The acid shows up toward the finish, long and funky, cheesy finish.  Very nice.  Lovely stuff, went back for this repeatedly, probably the beer of the evening.
Tap, not the best gueuze but pretty it pours  a nice light yellow, the aroma is sweet and the taste is a nice souriness, pretty good offering. Tasty stuff

Draught at Moeder Lambic, FontainasHazy golden color, with small but creamy head. Deep and dry aroma of cellar and cobwebs, Bretts; some ammonia, and light hazelnuts. Dry mouthfeel, with some citrusy acidity and some hidden malt. Well balanced, very pleasant, refreshing.
On tap at Moeder in Brussels. Light golden yellow with large head. Head took a while to fade. Very nice, thinner body, light grain with complex sour finish.

On draft at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pale yellow with a massive head of small bubbles which quickly diminishes to small consistent head. Citrus sour aroma. A bit funky but nice. Taste is grapefruit and a bit of orange and mango. Very fruity. Aftertaste is a bit like cream soda. Soft carbonation, and medium bodied, quite tingly on the tongue. Sourness is quite subtle. Very nice.
Draught at Delirium Cafe, Brussels, Belgium august 2011. Pale, hazy. Vineger aroma and taste.

A hazed golden gueuze with a thick creamy and frothy white head. In aroma, smooth wheat, epsom slats, lactic points, horseblanket, quite nice. In mouth, a smooth gueuze with lactic character, ground cherries, smooth and refreshing. On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, July 13, 2011.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Pours a cloudy golden-orange with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Aroma, a bit mild for the style, is citrusy and tart along with some wood, light herbs and a hint of alcohol. Flavour has a touch of what I describe as "metal" at first but it dissipates and whats left is quite good: Tart and sour, citrusy and woody -- almost like an easy-to-drink Lambic. Average to medium bodied. Well done, I thought it was quite good.

Draught  Huge, off-white dense head, over yellow beer, leaving shards of lace. Malts, citric, lemon and very "Bretty". Real gueuze flavour, citric as few, but surprisingly much less Cantillon-like than the bottled version. Light to medium bodied, obvious wheatslickness, very refreshing. Great,and interesting different version.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Clear golden beer with a small offwhite head. Rubber and manure aroma, sour, grass, burnt notes, grapefruit, hay, vinous, floral notes. Rubber aroma, floral, sour, dry, salty notes, hay, floral, some grapefruit. Rather refreshing.
On draft.  I really enjoyed this nIce gueze.  Golden color with a nice white head.  Great earthy tart clean taste.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2011 On tap. Translucent gold-amber, thin white ring for a head. Nose of pineapple, lemon, light cantillon brett in sweat and hay. More grapefruit, saddle, and sweat on the flavor, soft as it approaches doughy mid-palate. Very faint citrus throughout. Pleasant but not very unique or expressive, and I find it a bit sweet for a geuze. 847415
On tap. As a Gueuze lover I think this is an excellent exemplar. Its easy to drink enough and it respects all the gueuze characteristics. I love it. Very good job.

tap at moeder lambic.   pours a hazed creamy yellow with orange highlights and a large frothy white head.  aroma of citrus, grapefruit, with some awesome dusty basement cobweb must.  lactic acid, wet grass, lemon grass.   quite rustic.  taste is dry herbal, lemon and green tea.  slightly watery.   moderate level of sourness.  great balance.  ultra drinkable.  awesome beer.   hit the spot.
On draft @ moeder Lambic, is a very nice tender gueuze one is very easy to drink and got so mutch more potential to get old in the good way.
